clinical_study.brief_title: Analgesic Efficacy of the Novel Intra- Semispinal Fascial Plane Block in Posterior Cervical Spine Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Analgesic Efficacy of the Novel Intra- Semispinal Fascial Plane Block in Posterior Cervical Spine Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: Posterior cervical spine surgery often requires a large posterior midline incision, resulting in poorly controlled postoperative pain, which arises from iatrogenic mechanical damage, intraoperative retraction, and resection to structures such as bone, ligaments, muscles, intervertebral discs, and zygapophysial joints.

detailed_description.textblock: Ultrasound-guided Inter-semispinal plane (ISP) block, was proposed as a novel technique for analgesia in posterior cervical spine surgeries. The ISP block involves an injection of local anesthetic into the fascial plane between the semispinalis cervicis and semispinal capitis muscles and results in blocking the dorsal rami of the cervical spinal nerves. ISP block can provide effective analgesia in posterior cervical spine surgery

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study will be performed in neurosurgical operating rooms and included 70 patients allocated randomly into two groups: 35 patients recruited in the block group (I) for the Inter-semispinal plane block and 35 patients recruited in the (C) control group.
study_design_info.masking_description: Randomization assignments will be kept in sealed envelopes until all preprocedural measurements will be completed, and then they are opened by the research anesthesiologist immediately prior to the nerve block.

primary_outcome.measure: Postoperative pain will be assessed using Numerical Pain Score (NRS) score
primary_outcome.description: Numerical Pain Score (NRS) ranges from 0 to 10, where 0 is no pain, and 10 is the worst pain imaginable. Adequate pain control will be considered at Numerical Pain Score (NRS) < 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Total opioids consumed intraoperative and for 8 hours postoperative will be calculated.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: total fentanyl dose that will be used for entire operative time and morphine that will be used up to 8 hours postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Total intraoperative fentanyl and total morphine will be used postoperatively. Postoperative morphine will be considered if the postoperative VAS score >3 or the patient requested additional analgesia. Rescue analgesia of intravenous morphine will be given.

arm_group.description: After aseptic preparation of the injection area, the needle will be introduced in-plane through the skin and advanced into the fascial plane between the semispinalis cervicis and semispinalis capitis muscles. After negative aspiration for blood, 20 ml of 0.25% bupivacaine and 2 mg of dexamethasone on each side will be injected for each block.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients' acceptance.
- ASA I and II.
- Age above 21 years and below 60 years in both sexes.
- Cooperative patients.
- Patients with a BMI (body mass index) ranged from 18.5 to 30 kg/m2.
- Patients who scheduled for elective posterior cervical spine surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cardiovascular or respiratory compromise.
- Coagulopathy.
- Advanced hepatic or renal diseases.
- Local tissue infection.
- Allergy to local anesthesia.
